column5: My condolences to the Toronto Firefighter who lost his life today doing what he does best. Rest in Peace brother  Denis OFD
Amen, my heartfelt condolance to his family.  Joey
After 25 years on the force. A terrible thing for sure. My condolences to his family and friends.  It's just amazing that there weren't more casualties.
Tough day for all us Toronto Fire Fighters. Losing one of your own doesn't happen often and hurts us all when it does.  Our thoughts are all going out to his family and his co-workers.  Mike
It's tough when you lose one of your own, my condolences to his family and his brothers

Thought this was needed.  The FIRE FIGHTER'S PRAYER When I am called to duty, God Where ever flames may rage, Give me the strength to save some life Whatever be its age. Help me embrace a little child Before it is to late Or save an older person from The horror of that fate. Enable me to be alert and hear the weakest shout And quickly and efficiently To put the fire out I want to fill my calling and To give the best in me, To guard my every neighbor and Protect his property. And if according to my fate I am to lose my life Please bless with your protecting hand My children and my wife.
True hero.  BTW, LODD is a death in the line of duty, the highest honour in service.  NYFD showed that in spades about seven years ago, another tribute to commitment to the public.  God Bless.
My condolences and thoughts out to the family and close friends of the fire fighter.
